channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: One of the world's rarest whales that makes the Atlantic its home grows in population

10/20: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: President Trump says Hamas “will behave” or “we’re going to go in”; Former White House press secretary defends Joe Biden’s fitness as president.

item.title: WATCH: Volcano watchers silhouetted against Kilauea's lava fountain
item.description: A pair of volcano watchers were silhouetted against Mount Kilauea's lava fountain.

item.title: Weather balloon may have hit and cracked United flight's windshield

item.title: Man arrested for allegedly threatening to shoot up airport
item.description: The man's family alerted police and he was taken into custody, authorities said.

item.title: Lime growers' leader killed after complaining about cartel extortion
item.description: The body of Bernardo Bravo, president of the Apatzingan Valley Citrus Producers Association, was found in his vehicle, officials said.

item.title: WATCH: George Santos hits out at critics after prison release
item.description: The disgraced former congressman slammed critics who opposed his release from prison after President Donald Trump commuted his sentence for wire fraud...

item.title: Pardoned Capitol rioter charged with threatening to murder Hakeem Jeffries
item.description: A pardoned Capitol rioter was arrested last weekend for allegedly threatening to kill the top House Democrat.

item.title: Blue Jays in World Series for first time since 1993
item.description: The Toronto Blue Jays are back in the World Series for the first time since 1993

item.title: ICE would need more money to expand use of bodycams in Chicago crackdown, official says
What to know about the recovery efforts in Alaska following ex-Typhoon Halong
US appeals court says Trump can take command of Oregon troops though deployment blocked for now
item.description: A U.S. appeals court has ruled that President Donald Trump can take command of 200 Oregon National Guard troops.
